p: Since ML may identify non-linear SNP-SNP interactions, pairwise interaction tests were performed for all top SNPs identified using machine learning models (Tables 1 and 2). Of 17,205 SNP-SNP pairwise interactions, 13 pairs were significant under a standard regression framework (encoded as a multiplicative interaction) after accounting for multiple testing and excluding pairs where both are within the APOE region. The two SNP-SNP pairs with the strongest evidence for association were between SNPs rs405509 and rs600550 (beta = 0.058, pFDR = 6.8 × 10−5), and SNPs rs405509 and rs12421663 (beta = −0.056, pFDR = 1.8 × 10−4), both of which involve SNPs in the APOE and MS4A* regions (Supplementary Data 6, Supplementary section 2.5).
